issue.title: Non-top-level namespace posix shouldn't be reserved

discussion.p:
The namespace posix is made reserved by .
It is clear in the paper that only ::posix is intendedly reserved, but the current normative wording is not clear enough on this (see also LWG ).

blockquote.p: -1- The behavior of a C++ program is undefined if it adds declarations or definitions to top-level namespace posix or to a namespace within that namespace posix unless otherwise specified. The top-level namespace posix is reserved for use by ISO/IEC/IEEE 9945 and other POSIX standards.
